definition:
Let $\{K_\alpha\}$, $\alpha \in J$, be a collection of subfields of a
field $L$. The [*composite field*]{} of the collection is the smallest
subfield of $L$ that contains all the fields $K_\alpha$.

The notation $K_1 K_2$ (resp., $K_1 K_2 \dots K_n$) is often used to
denote the composite field of two (resp., finitely many) fields.
